positive.review:
Literally better than Battlefield 6 by far

- Still has classic Server Browser
- No Bots that ruins the game and Matchmaking experience
- Classic Battlefield Maps with probably best DLC a Battlefield ever had
- Clean Menu
- Clean Settings
- Better Engine version (Classic Battlefield feeling from BF3, BF4, BFH, BF1)
- Classic Battlefield Pace
- Insane Graphics
- Easier to hear Steps

Recommended (Thumbs Up)
Playtime: ~100+ hours
If you crave destruction, teamwork, and WWII vibes without the historical whitewashing, BFV is your ticket. It's not perfect, but it's damn closeâ€”and way better than grinding battle royales for skins. 9/10, would storm Omaha Beach again. same struggling to reach peak in Iwo Jima mountains, welcome to rice field in wild forest dark deep nature solomon islands total wild and more and more the maps like rotterdam & operation underground in cities area literally BFV delivers every possible beautiful scenery.The single-player War Stories are a mixed bagâ€”short
but yes you will enjoy doing achievements in those but BF1 war stories are much more rich.

Gameplay wise: Those heart-pounding "oh crap, I'm surrounded" moments. Gunplay is buttery smooth.
That signature Battlefield "pop" on headshots that just feels right.Medics chaining revives like a boss. This game also introduced with  Ray-tracing via DLSS, modern machines can really enjoy the beauty of this game.

Current state: Still servers are full of players 64/64 most of the times. Met new people doing achievements with them are fun very much enjoyed every bit of this game.

Must recommend 100% â¤ï¸grab it on sale it's an absolute steal for what it offers.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3606747380
Kinda epic, Pacific war update kinda saved the game but a little too late
love the campaign, dont really mind the sweats in online matches the game is fun in general
A vey good and emersive game to play. But i didn't enjoy the multiplayer mode as much as the story mode
i rather play bf5 then that lame bf6 like wtf is that junk. bf5 will forever be the end of bf and the best one so far

Campaign review: The first two acts are ok, if you like over the top melodramatic writing with very little realism or character development. Acts 3 & 4 are a huge improvement on this, with more large scale battles, better character development and some help from allied soldiers. It really does look and sound phenomenal too, huge props to the sound design team especially. DICE just made some odd choices with the campaign design.

Overall, thereâ€™s just too much stealth in a game that's clearly not designed for stealth. Just let us play Battlefield please! Give us some teammates and large scale historical WW2 battles, not solo commando runs with broken stealth. 

Firstly, enemies have super human detection abilities, so youâ€™re constantly forced to go solo guns blazing when every single encounter devolves into a brainless shooting gallery once stealth goes to pot. Also, why does every other German soldier carry a heavy machine gun, a rocket launcher and seemingly endless grenades? And donâ€™t even get me started on the pointless hypothermia mechanic they randomly introduce for 5mins of gameplay in the second act. Just some odd choices across the board. 

I also encountered some weird glitches, like getting stuck with the binoculars or not being able to change weapons without mashing the weapon swap button a few times first.. very annoying when youâ€™re out of ammo in the middle of a firefight.

Don't buy this for the campaign unless it's significantly discounted. 6/10.

If you're the kind of player who loves stunning visuals, teamwork, and epic moments that feel straight out of a movie â€” or an anime battle â€” Battlefield V is definitely a game worth diving into. ðŸ’¥ðŸŒ

its a great way to cool off after a long day (i said excitedly) i was then diddled by the sweatiest most B less sniper mains even known to mankind


but i have learned to enjoy that somehow
this is a great game for ww2 vidio game lovers its really fun, if you have good fps

This is an underrated Battlefield Game, this game has so much potential if EA never gone blunder and faithful to the series before the 2042 disaster, this game gave sense of preview to BF6 Movement and tech thats enhanced and improved gunplay. Few things thats better about this game than BF6 is the sheer map size and flow, Vehicle variety, Soldier costumization, and rebuild and fortify mechanic, i hope these features could get updated un BF6 later updates
i got the game i killed some people, i went to war, i got out alive and i played the game. it was cool

I mean its fine... I made a review even when battlefield 6 is already released...

but I just can't stand the boring... the single player missions are just so boring. I am always alone and on foot, like isn't there anything else for it? When I reached the last single player story. Not again. Why I'm on foot again? 

if the devs can just... Haven't tried bf6 campaign yet. Haven't purchased even now has a free trial and 15% off...

In a nutshell: If you prefer chaotic battles and satisfying gunplay with smooth movement, get the game when it's on sale

In details: gameplay is smooth and fluid (cuz players run faster in this game than bf6 ion know why DICE decided that way), pretty responsive, maps are big enough for snipers to goon while camping, cool historical skin customizations. Upgrade paths are good, creative and complex, especially the vehicles in which u can choose which type of cannons for your tanks. In-battle vehicle driving is pretty cool cuz u can switch to both fpv and tpv, but fpv while driving cars with yo squadmates on gives you the power of friendship and dive into the heavily fired area just to be slaped by a tank from 300 meters away. but overall, planes to planes, ground to ground, boats to boats, or of course, mixed, those interactions makes the game more alive

Also the definitive edition is enough cuz completing weekly missions are enough to get you in-game currencies to get the skins you want, no need for additional spendings cuz this game isn't pay to win anway.

the game runs good at med settings 1080p more than 160fps on my dumbass rtx 3050 6gb vram laptop, one can say if u wanna play bf6 but your lap bouta explode, then bfv is a good alternative

surprisingly I rarely see hackers (YES meaning I met some, but not to a certain level that the game is unfkable), and also I aint see no bots cuz those enemies keep sitting on my face ragebaiting after killing me, welp, pretty alive cuz I did em first.... and I love it

> If ure looking for mass shooting games, welp give the franchise a chance, or if ur done playing bf6 and wanna look for other similar games, bfv and bf1 are good choices

even tho the player base gradually drops, there are no bots in any game i have played so far (more than 100 matches, not counting those that I rage quit), usually fully 64 mindless dudes, so just dw abt it

yea more than 100hours aint gonna certify me to be trustful to give all good reviews about this game and without any bad shi
maybe one bad shi is that the tanks are too overpowered

again, just watch ytb to have a better view, thats all

But somehow the actual gameplay is probably the best of any online FPS you can find. So long as you can put the stupid character models to the back of your (or focus on shooting them) then you'll have lots of fun
The overall gameplay of the campaing is the best always like a cinematic movie and also the campaign story is the best
Second best game after BF6 in BF series. Sadly EA failed to capatilize its full potential.
high quality games, historic, and educational game
Great graphics and solid gameplay - still (or should I say in the end?) a great BF.

Lots of fun with friends, visually stunning maps although many are unbalanced/too open. Gun play is enjoyable (some guns are op), a bit more recoil than the other battlefield games I've played. Audio, destruction, building fortification mechanics and movement are all awesome.

This game is really beautiful. So much vibrant colours and large scale maps. This is soo much fun.

Battlefield V is a damn rollercoaster. When it works, itâ€™s absolutely amazing â€” explosions everywhere, chaotic firefights, and those â€œholy shitâ€ moments that only Battlefield can pull off. The sound design hits hard, the movement feels smooth as hell, and some maps are straight-up gorgeous.

But then the game decides to piss you off.

The time-to-kill feels like it changes every other match, hit-reg likes to take a nap whenever it wants, and sometimes you die to stuff that makes you question your entire existence. And donâ€™t even get me started on the random bugs â€” they show up like uninvited guests and ruin the vibe.

Overall? Battlefield V is a badass game wrapped in a messy package. When itâ€™s good, it slaps. When itâ€™s not, it makes you want to slam your keyboard through the table.

I played a lot of this BF5 when it first game out in PS4 and honestly it was a blast. Coming back to it after I was a little disappointed with BF6's map sizes + weapon variety. It honestly is still awesome. Air combat is amazing. The feel is just top notch. It's great to see full servers still.

no doubt the best and most immersive games i've played. dreamt of playing it when i was still a kid and the game was still new. the lobby still doing fine till today, though hackers or cheaters are still in the game but only a few

First two stories in the game were boring. Two stealth and solo missions consecutively. Tirailleur is the first mission in the game with open battle and lives true with the Battlefield title. The Last Tiger too is an amazing story. They are the only reason why I am giving a good review for BFV.
its battlefield love this game. and also best graphics of the Battlefield Series
This game plays better than Battlefield 1, and with the definitive version, it removes the microtransaction hell from initial release. Highly recommened :]

Battlefield V is a first-person shooter developed by DICE and published by Electronic Arts. Released in 2018, it returns the series to World War II with an emphasis on squad-based gameplay, large-scale battles, and environmental destruction powered by the Frostbite engine. It follows the Battlefield 1 formula but focuses on mobility, customization, and team coordination.

Gameplay combines infantry combat with vehicle warfare across massive, dynamic maps. Gunplay feels tighter than in previous entries, with noticeable recoil control and weapon differentiation. The new attrition system limits ammo and health regeneration, forcing players to rely more on support classes and resupply points. The emphasis on teamwork makes lone-wolf play less effective but adds tension and realism to coordinated fights.

Visually, Battlefield V is outstanding. The lighting, particle effects, and destructible environments create a cinematic battlefield atmosphere. Maps range from snowy Norwegian fjords to North African deserts and urban ruins, each designed for both scale and tactical depth. The destruction system remains one of the best in the genre, altering cover and sightlines dynamically as battles progress.

The single-player â€œWar Storiesâ€ campaign offers short, self-contained narratives from different perspectives of the war. These missions are well-produced but limited in scope and replay value. The writing aims for empathy and diversity rather than historical accuracy, resulting in mixed reception among players expecting a more traditional portrayal of WWII.

Multiplayer is the heart of the game. Classic modes like Conquest and Breakthrough return alongside the evolving â€œTides of Warâ€ live-service system that added new maps, weapons, and cosmetics over time. The lack of content at launch hurt its initial reception, but updates later expanded it into a more complete experience.

Technically, the game performs well, though early versions suffered from bugs and balance issues that were gradually resolved. Sound design is exceptionalâ€”gunfire, explosions, and voice chatter create immersive battlefield chaos. The engine handles large-scale physics and destruction efficiently on modern hardware.

In summary, Battlefield V is a visually stunning and mechanically refined shooter that captures the intensity of large-scale warfare. Itâ€™s not the most historically grounded or content-rich entry at launch, but its core gameplay and presentation remain among the strongest in the series. For players seeking dynamic, teamwork-driven battles with top-tier audiovisual fidelity, it remains a solid and evolving installment in the Battlefield franchise.

The Immersion isnt as great as BF1 but overall great experience.

What a bipolar game. 

The map design goes from being among the best Iâ€™ve experienced in all of Battlefield, with a good mix of open field, dense cities, and downright gorgeous maps, to the most dull three-lane claustrophobic corridor maps or flat open maps where the team with the most tanks or the best pilots wins by default.

The class design combines some of the smartest choices theyâ€™ve done, like Recon, which has a kit that makes them more of a flanker/pathfinder for the team rather than just a sniper and scout in sharp contrast to the fact that Assault has both the best primary weapons and all the anti-vehicle gadgets and launchers, which is just ridiculous.

The graphics, animations, movement and destruction are also on point. But I would have wished for a bit longer time-to-kill or less accurate weapons to create a more intense shootout experience rather than a meatgrinder.

I kind of regret not picking this up earlier, like a year after launch, when it wouldâ€™ve been possible to get some friends on board, because playing with random squadmates is also a complete coinflip in terms of skill and general game awareness.

Oh, and the campaign is quite poor. Linear corridors where they take some puzzling liberties in re-telling mostly unknown tales from WW2. As a Norwegian who has been told about the Rjukan-operation since I was I child, I can't get why they didn't just go with the real life story rather than making up their own. 

Why DICE even bothers wasting resources on making campaigns when theyâ€™ve never managed anything better than "okay+" in the Bad Company games is something I'll never understand.

negative.review:
Battlefield V: Definitive Edition tries to deliver a polished World War II experience but ends up feeling like a messy mix of questionable design choices, inconsistent gunplay, and constant balance issues that make every match feel unpredictable in the worst way. The time-to-kill swings wildly between patches, visibility is often terrible thanks to excessive particle effects and washed-out lighting, and the lack of meaningful content at launch left a bad first impression that still lingers. Many maps feel awkwardly designed, encouraging frustrating chokepoints or empty wandering, and the attrition system turns basic gunfights into scavenger hunts for ammo and health. Despite the â€œDefinitive Editionâ€ label, the game can still suffer from bugs, strange hit detection, and teamplay that falls apart when players ignore objectives. Meanwhile, Black Ops 7 treated as a hypothetical future title feels like the complete opposite: fast, smooth, tightly balanced, loaded with customization, and built around gunplay that actually feels responsive and satisfying. Where Battlefield V feels unfocused, inconsistent, and often more exhausting than fun, Black Ops 7 delivers modern pacing, stable performance, and gameplay that keeps players engaged instead of frustrated.

The setting of World War II being revisionist history'd into oblivion. There were NOT equal amounts of female soldiers in the Wehrmacht as there were men. There were NOT equal amounts of females in GIs with elite weaponry storming Normandy. This game is a disgrace that shits on the memory of people who were dragged from their homes to die shrieking alone and in agony on foreign soil to save the world.

Maybe women were in plenty of modern wars, but I for one am sick of seeing the heroics and sacrifice of men being credited to everyone instead of those who actually fought and died for it. Women suffered in WWII, it's certainly true, but men fought it. Let's not keep teaching new generations lies until noone remembers what happened.

I know this is like saying the sky is blue, but shame on you, EA. I really want to switch from the slurry COD has become back to Battlefield but you're making it hard with this kind of pandering. The game is mechanically fine in every way! Really, it's fantastic, and aesthetically it's beautiful, with excellent scenery, music, satisfying weapons... but the disingenuousness and lack of morals in inexcusable. Whether this is being done soulely for profit or if there's dangerous social engineering at play as well, straight-facedly trying to sell this Bizarro World rendition of WWII as a realistic shooter is erasing a sufferage that was purely men's burden and torture: being drafted back in the most brutal days of oldschool war where you were likely to get your shit bayonetted out. This isn't even something as mild as denying a woman's issue like the paygap, for example: these men lost every day of every year of the rest of their lives and every tender moment with a loved one, every song and joke they'd ever hear and every hot meal they'd enjoy to go get hacked apart and burned alive after waiting in some miserable freezing trench or in the guts of plane after plane after ship to get to the front, and it happened to an incomprehensible amount of male lives. Brainwashing a new generation to believe otherwise is like writing any of the other atrocities like black slavery, the british occupation or the Rwandan Genocide out of history using media intended to entertain. 

I know some bloody redditors are sitting there saying 'yeah, but all of what happens in Battlefield is fiction anyway because the characters aren't real!' Sure. That's true, but there's a difference between setting a james bond fiction in the real world with a few fake characters and rewriting that whole world in a subtle but vast way and portraying that as though that's how the setting really was back then to a huge audience, many of whom are bound to buy it. Meanwhile you'd have to have a single-digit IQ to take for granted that the characters in CoD are all faithfully recreating real people.

Movies and games might seem like they're just for entertainment, but entertaining media has always been used to airbrush away horrible things people did. Uncle Remus just loved being a slave in Song of the South and all the Indians are just so stoked to be serving their abusive British bosses as they get kicked around and screamed at in It Aint Half Hot Mum. You know what the brits did in India? It wasn't good.

And save your clown stickers, hysterical lefties: I'm not advocating that women be left out of war settings, I'm advocating for the truth: that we should tell history as faithfully as we can. Yes, by all means write a fiction, but it should never masqurade as anything but a fiction in matters as grave as tremendous amounts of people dying horiffically, especially within living memory. You might as well write an alternate history where the holocaust never took place and present it as real for how vile and revisionist it'd be.

The game (campaign) is supposed to be realistic but you must fight an whole army on your own which in this case does not feel right. Also it is not one story but several historical events which is like you are playing short DLC's.

The game is a good game, but its awful servers are as bad as EA's reputation, which is embarrassing to talk about. Frequent disconnects, network lag, and stuttering happen all the time, and there are countless cheats. Turning a perfectly good game into this mess is unmatched.

Battlefield V: Definitive Edition tries to deliver a polished World War II experience but ends up feeling like a messy mix of questionable design choices, inconsistent gunplay, and constant balance issues that make every match feel unpredictable in the worst way. The time-to-kill swings wildly between patches, visibility is often terrible thanks to excessive particle effects and washed-out lighting, and the lack of meaningful content at launch left a bad first impression that still lingers. Many maps feel awkwardly designed, encouraging frustrating chokepoints or empty wandering, and the attrition system turns basic gunfights into scavenger hunts for ammo and health. Despite the â€œDefinitive Editionâ€ label, the game can still suffer from bugs, strange hit detection, and teamplay that falls apart when players ignore objectives. Meanwhile, Black Ops 7 treated as a hypothetical future title feels like the complete opposite: fast, smooth, tightly balanced, loaded with customization, and built around gunplay that actually feels responsive and satisfying. Where Battlefield V feels unfocused, inconsistent, and often more exhausting than fun, Black Ops 7 delivers modern pacing, stable performance, and gameplay that keeps players engaged instead of frustrated.

The setting of World War II being revisionist history'd into oblivion. There were NOT equal amounts of female soldiers in the Wehrmacht as there were men. There were NOT equal amounts of females in GIs with elite weaponry storming Normandy. This game is a disgrace that shits on the memory of people who were dragged from their homes to die shrieking alone and in agony on foreign soil to save the world.

Maybe women were in plenty of modern wars, but I for one am sick of seeing the heroics and sacrifice of men being credited to everyone instead of those who actually fought and died for it. Women suffered in WWII, it's certainly true, but men fought it. Let's not keep teaching new generations lies until noone remembers what happened.

I know this is like saying the sky is blue, but shame on you, EA. I really want to switch from the slurry COD has become back to Battlefield but you're making it hard with this kind of pandering. The game is mechanically fine in every way! Really, it's fantastic, and aesthetically it's beautiful, with excellent scenery, music, satisfying weapons... but the disingenuousness and lack of morals in inexcusable. Whether this is being done soulely for profit or if there's dangerous social engineering at play as well, straight-facedly trying to sell this Bizarro World rendition of WWII as a realistic shooter is erasing a sufferage that was purely men's burden and torture: being drafted back in the most brutal days of oldschool war where you were likely to get your shit bayonetted out. This isn't even something as mild as denying a woman's issue like the paygap, for example: these men lost every day of every year of the rest of their lives and every tender moment with a loved one, every song and joke they'd ever hear and every hot meal they'd enjoy to go get hacked apart and burned alive after waiting in some miserable freezing trench or in the guts of plane after plane after ship to get to the front, and it happened to an incomprehensible amount of male lives. Brainwashing a new generation to believe otherwise is like writing any of the other atrocities like black slavery, the british occupation or the Rwandan Genocide out of history using media intended to entertain. 

I know some bloody redditors are sitting there saying 'yeah, but all of what happens in Battlefield is fiction anyway because the characters aren't real!' Sure. That's true, but there's a difference between setting a james bond fiction in the real world with a few fake characters and rewriting that whole world in a subtle but vast way and portraying that as though that's how the setting really was back then to a huge audience, many of whom are bound to buy it. Meanwhile you'd have to have a single-digit IQ to take for granted that the characters in CoD are all faithfully recreating real people.

Movies and games might seem like they're just for entertainment, but entertaining media has always been used to airbrush away horrible things people did. Uncle Remus just loved being a slave in Song of the South and all the Indians are just so stoked to be serving their abusive British bosses as they get kicked around and screamed at in It Aint Half Hot Mum. You know what the brits did in India? It wasn't good.

And save your clown stickers, hysterical lefties: I'm not advocating that women be left out of war settings, I'm advocating for the truth: that we should tell history as faithfully as we can. Yes, by all means write a fiction, but it should never masqurade as anything but a fiction in matters as grave as tremendous amounts of people dying horiffically, especially within living memory. You might as well write an alternate history where the holocaust never took place and present it as real for how vile and revisionist it'd be.

Like expected another garbage game from EA. I had to waste about 10-15min of my precious life for an abysmal intro, that i couldnt skip, even though i just want to play the multiplayer. After that i had to wait like 10 minutes to join a game in the loading screen. Then the game crashed. After another 10 min of playing i could finally play my first game. After about 15 min my game crashed again. Just play battlebit instead.

This game is terrible. Matchmaking is awful, and the gameplay is just as bad. I wasted the first 30 minutes figuring out why my game was running at negative FPS, only to discover it was somehow set to DX12â€¦ bruh.

When I finally queued up for a match, I got completely destroyed. Thereâ€™s no way to push the objectives because a huge alley gives the enemy free line of sight to mow us down, so we lose with zero chance. And to even stand a chance, you need better weapons, but to unlock those, you have to kill enemies using the garbage starter weapons. Itâ€™s a vicious cycle that makes the game unfun from the start.

Vehicles donâ€™t help either. If you somehow get one, youâ€™re still doomed because the enemy team always has maxed-out tanks and pilots with 7,240 hours in War Thunder.

Overall, itâ€™s a miserable experience, and Iâ€™d much rather play Battlefield 1. DICE really needs to lock in and fix this mess in the future.
